info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 30 at 9:02PM EDT until September 30 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of western North Carolina, including the following county, Burke. * WHEN...Until midnight EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 859 PM EDT, Automated rain gages across the county were averaging around 2 inches of rainfall so far today and with the threat of additional heavy showers through late evening, as much as 3 or 3.5 inches may accumulate in spots. Please be wary of rising stream levels and developing flooding of low-lying areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hickory, Morganton, Longview, Valdese, Gamewell, Salem, Icard, Drexel, Hildebran, Connelly Springs, Rutherford College, Glen Alpine, Rhodhiss, Table Rock, South Mountains State Park, Lake James State Park, Lake Rhodhiss, Lake James, Hickory Regional Airport and Linville Falls. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
